facts.text: Art Alexakis wrote 'Santa Monic' after fleeing abusive childhood in LA for a fresh start in Oregon!
'Santa Monica' is a bitter breakup anthem about an ex who chased Hollywood dreams and left him broken.
Everclear's 1997 album So. So. Clean was named after Alexakis' heroin-addicted mom's insult to his messy house!
Art Alexakis survived a 1988 suicide attempt and homelessness before Everclear's breakthrough.
The iconic beach bonfire scene was shot at Leo Carrillo State Park, a popular spot for SoCal parties.
Video director Marc Webb later helmed massive hits like (500) Days of Summer and The Amazing Spider-Man!
Grunge was fading, pop ruled radio, but Everclear's post-grunge sound hit big in 1997's alt-rock scene.
Peaked at #1 on Billboard's Modern Rock chart for 3 weeks, outselling many grunge holdovers.
Song's released amid 1997's Hanson mania and Puff Daddy dominance – pure alt-rock rebellion!
Alexakis battled crippling agoraphobia during recording, channeling pain into the lyrics.
Video features real LA beachgoers; no paid extras – captured authentic SoCal chaos.
1997 saw Titanic's epic release and Diana's death – 'Santa Monica' was escapist summer rage.
Over 5 million So. So. Clean copies sold; launched Everclear to headlining arena tours.
Alexakis adopted his wife’s surname 'Everclear' from the grain alcohol for the band name.
Charted during the dial-up internet era – fans shared grainy RealPlayer rips online.
Video budget was modest $100K, but MTV rotation made it a visual staple of TRL's early days.
Art lost his brother to a heroin OD at 34, inspiring anti-drug themes in his raw lyrics.
Covered by Vitamin C in 2000; became a staple in teen rom-com soundtracks.
